transcript_segments.text: Hello! Welcome to Recipes Inmai Veet Inakku. Today we are going to make delicious Chicken Biryani using 750 grams of chicken and 600 grams of seeraga samba rice. Let's see how to prepare it and what ingredients are needed. First, add two teaspoons of oil in a pan.

Once the green chili changes color and is sautéed well, add a handful of mint leaves and half a handful of coriander leaves. Sauté on low flame for 30 seconds. Once sautéed well, grind it in a mixer with a little water.

Add four small pieces of cinnamon, 5 cloves, 5 cardamoms, 2 pieces of Marathi moggu, 2 star anise, and 1 tablespoon of black stone flower. Sauté for about 10 seconds. Then add 1 teaspoon of fennel seeds and 4 tablespoons of cashew nuts.

Chop 4 large onions lengthwise and add them to the pan. Use about 250 grams of onions. Add 3 tablespoons of finely chopped mint leaves. Sauté the onions until golden brown. We won’t be using tomatoes in this biryani.
Once the onions are sautéed well, add 5 tablespoons of ginger-garlic paste (approximately 100 grams). Sauté this until the raw smell disappears — about 1 minute — on medium flame.

instruction: Add a little water and grind the mixture into a smooth, fine green paste.
title: Grind green masala

transcript_segments.text: Add 1 tablespoon of kasuri methi and 1 tablespoon of turmeric powder. Sauté for 1 minute. Kasuri methi gives a great aroma and taste to the biryani. You can find this dried fenugreek in most departmental stores.

transcript_segments.text: If you use small pieces, they may break apart in the biryani. Add salt as needed for the chicken — about 1 tablespoon. Add about half a cup of water, mix well, and cook the chicken on medium flame for about 10–15 minutes.

instruction: Rinse the Seeraga Samba rice until the water runs clear, then soak it in water for 20 minutes.

transcript_segments.text: We cooked it for 15 minutes — it's half-cooked now. Stir well. For this biryani, I’ve soaked 2 glasses of seeraga samba rice. We'll add 3 glasses of water to cook it. That’s about 600 grams of rice.

After adding the water, add salt as needed — I’m adding 2 tablespoons. That should be enough. Add 2 tablespoons of biryani masala and 1 tablespoon of satkara (optional). Add 2 tablespoons of ghee as well.
Let the water come to a full boil for about 5 minutes. Now that it’s boiling, add the 2 glasses of soaked seeraga samba rice (after draining the water). Also, squeeze in half a lemon juice and stir.
